job_title: Therapeutic Day Treatment Counselor in Abingdon, VA
pros: Very fulfilling job opportunities in the helping field!
cons: There were no cons for me!

review_title: Good for a foot-in-the door job, not a career
job_title: Therapeutic Day Treatment Counselor in Abingdon, VA
pros: Good connections and relationships built in the company and community. Easy to have good recommendations when moving up the ladder or on to another field
cons: Poor management, low salary, little to no employee incentives, burnout, difficult population.

job_title: School Based Case Manager in Abingdon, VA
pros:
Nice supervisors 
School based hours & summers off
cons:
Company struggling for employees. Spreading employees thin with no extra money. You will do the job of several employees all by yourself. No one on offers to get you extra help or co-workers.
You get company holidays but you have to use your vacation time to take off. You can use all your earned vacation to pay for a so called company holiday. Never heard of this anywhere.

review_title: Not a bad place to work
pros:
Hybrid work from home 50% of the time. 
Ability to have control of your schedule.
cons:
High case load.
Too many expectations in regards to paperwork.

pros: Company has a good reputation in the community.

cons: Do not care about employees mental health.

pros: People were great to work with; sometimes free lunch
cons:
Higher ups did not care
Safety wasn't a concern
Thought we were working with Robots not people
I was treated better when I didn't have a degree
Masters only received 16 an hour.
Worked over a lot for no extra pay

pros: Rewarding work most of the time.
cons: The salary amount needs to be raised.

job_title: Therapeutic Day Treatment Counselor in Abingdon, VA
pros: Good management, excellent hours, time off in the summer
cons: The job probably won't exist much longer.

job_title: Intensive Case Manager in Abingdon, VA
pros: Supportive leadership, bosses that work as hard as their employees, great pay & great environment.  There always seems to be opportunity that the director provides to win prizes, PTO, and he's always looking for ways to boost morale.
cons: No cons in my opinion.  The job is tough work but nothing that you can't handle with a good work/life balance.  Highlands always encourages taking time off if you need it, with a great PTO rate to support that.

job_title: IDD Support Coordinator in Abingdon, VA
pros: Working alongside individuals with intellectual or developmental disabilities to assist them in all aspects of life and personal development.
cons: Untenable work expectations, low pay, high turnover and burnout, ineffective supervisors and management, frequently changing regulations and systems for documentation.

review_title: Upper management in Adult Recovery Services are not to be trusted.
pros: Rewarding work. Flexible for some people.
cons: Not flexible for the others. Used to be a good department but some new management changes her rules depending on the person. She is all about micromanaging some people that she doesn’t like. She has promoted her favorites to create a hostile and cliquey work environment. This used to be a great company to work for but they care more about money than their clients now. High turnover of staff due to management. Always have your resume ready to go because everywhere but Frontier Health will pay you and treat you better.

pros:
It's a great place to work when you first come on board with the agency.  
Benefits were ok, especially the retirement.
"Most" of the staff are great to work with - this doesn't include management.
The offices will close during inclement weather.
Pay was ok.
cons:
After the "new" wears off, you best start polishing your resume.  
The management staff needs leadership training, as it is obvious none of them have had no prior training.
It's all about the money - nothing else!

pros: Easy to talk to supervisors when there is an issue; IT Department is on top of computer issues that come up; pay is decent; benefits are unbeatable.
cons: Starting everyone in each department out at the same rate of pay regardless of experience or education.

pros: Retirement.. trainings, vacation pay and PTO
cons: Hours are crazy.. upper managements does little to help and dumps all their responsibilities on you.. no acknowledgement of achievements. All about the money not the families. If they can find a billable loophole they are going to drain every other agency to get it.
Atmosphere does not support and healthy work/life balance. Unsupportive management. Employee turn over is very high

review_title: A good place to work and develop a career within the Mental Health Society.

pros:
Great Coworkers
Great Benefits,
Holiday and Vacation is as Teacher's schedule.
cons: High burn out with Mental Health.

pros: promote from within, supportive of higher education
cons: No real cons with this company

pros: Most co-workers are great to work with.
cons: Have to use PTO for holidays. More about money than helping people. Micro management. Lucky if you get paid for PTO when you leave. No exit interview.Add to job description without increase in pay. Lack of constancy.
